text: <@U22RH7VGT>  - the only GRPC stuff in Java I know of is in the Java chaincode package.  It uses GRPC to communicate with the peer -   <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/master/core/chaincode/shim/java>
you might want to poke around in there to see what they did

Hi! I need some help in debugging the issue I am facing with my hyperledger block chain deployment. I have a hyperledger fabric deployment with 4 nodes (pbft consensus is enabled). I deployed a couple of smart contract and it worked fine for one day. But today when I am invoking smart contract I am noticing that the transaction is not getting distributed to all the peers and the transaction is never included in any block. In fact the block chain height is not changing at all! I looked at peer log and do not see any `ERR`. Only one peer to which I submitted the transaction shows these logs:
```
[2016-09-29 17:15:01+0000] 17:15:01.705 [devops] invokeOrQuery -> INFO 767a Transaction ID: 8c91e0ac-5e8d-41ca-8845-c6c72f27ad1d
[2016-09-29 17:15:01+0000] 17:15:01.705 [rest] processChaincodeInvokeOrQuery -> INFO 767b Successfully submitted invoke transaction with txuuid (8c91e0ac-5e8d-41ca-8845-c6c72f27ad1d)
[2016-09-29 17:15:01+0000] 17:15:01.705 [rest] ProcessChaincode -> INFO 767c REST successfully submitted invoke transaction: {jsonrpc:2.0,result:{status:OK,message:8c91e0ac-5e8d-41ca-8845-c6c72f27ad1d},id:0}
```
Any pointers on what to look for in logs to know what is the problem? I am using `0.5-developer preview` release
<@U1MFW8CFM> if you can't query  about it ,i think  you deploy chaincode isn't success.or you can 'docker ps ' get the chaincode containers .

<@U2C55KE65> chaincode was deployed successfully and I had invoked it successfully previously. Also, query operations are successful. Somehow now the invoke operations are not getting added in the blockchain and new changes won't propagate to world state.
also I noticed that (by doing `docker ps -a`) that new docker containers are not getting created

<@U251ZDKJ5>  `peer` should be in your path if you have gone through the devenv setup, and built the `peer` executable via the `make` command.  you may have to relogin for the path changes to take affect
<@U1Z1KQDMM|rajnair2k> has joined the channel
<@U1MFW8CFM>: many of us are traveling today unfortunately I am one of them;-)
is there a reason you are using v0.5?
there was a bug that sounds like what you are running, but I believe it was fixed. You might want to consider upgrading to v0.6-preview but you'll need to adapt your chaincode

Hi, Just trying to clear my concept. In general Blockchain is an irrevocable and immutable ledger - Hyperledger Fabric also is - as per definition.
Now, I have been using a table to store my data in Fabric.
But If I have a replaceRow API or deleteRow API, then isn't that going to conflict the concept of Blockchain itself ?
<@U1CS08EP3> I think you are conflating the state of a chaincode application with the history of the state changes
something like “deleteRow” can help transition from one state to the next, but that is independent of the history of steps that brought us to a specific state at a point in time
the “blockchain” is part of the history mechanism
does that make sense
so your application can “mutate” its state to transition from an old state to a new state, and the blockchain can record the history of all of those transitions, and both concepts can coexist

<@U0KPFAZNF> , Hmm. Now I get it. History remains intact. Hence the concept of Blockchain prevails. 
And any such operation like delete/replace etc, is actually transforming the present state -> to another state. 
Ohkay. Agreed. Thanks <@U0KPFAZNF>
Right.  It's like how git works.  You can delete a file "now", but the history that the file once existed still remains
:slightly_smiling_face:  as simple an example as that  :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi i am trying to use node-sdk on ibm bluemix. i am getting following error on the first call to any invoke or query functions.  Error: { [Error] code: 14, metadata: Metadata { _internal_repr: {} } }

<@U12AHQ3NK> I haven't used BlueMix so I may not have the necessary context for your question.  However, it seems like there have been a number of challenges because BlueMix is still on Fabric v0.5  while everything else has moved forward with backwards incompatible changes
ohh. <@U23S3DPFY>  Is it because of gRPC calls with tls?
or the error is  specific to bluemix blockchian network?

not sure.  I just know that the difference in versions causes somethings to break.  e.g. example chaincode that works with BlueMix does not work with Fabric at the moment, and vica versa.  I'm just speculating that your problem might be related, especially if you are using the most recent Node SDK code
I think the Node SDK is new as of this month, so I'm guessing there isn't a v0.5 compatible version
<@U1CTBUNEN>  Can you please post the command used to start the membersrvc ?
<@U1CTBUNEN>  membersrv should be enabled with "ACA" in order to work with attributes.  Try using command "MEMBERSRVC_CA_ACA_ENABLED=true membersrvc" for starting membersrv it worked for me.
